page.title: 01GAZETEER OF MADDERTY
page.content: Madderty is a parish,not a town or a village, which lies in the lovely valley of Strathearn. It is 7 miles Crieff and 11 miles from Perth. The scenery is beautiful. We are rich in wildlife. Tourists often visit us. The area is mostly farmland. Barley is the main crop. It is a farming community.People live mainly on farms quite a distance from each other. There is a small village of around 40 people called St Davids.About one and a half miles from the village there is a primary school.The schoolhouse attached to the school is 151 years old but the school has been modernised. Near the school is the Abbey Church. The church, the school and the village hall are where people meet.
